NATIONS UNIES
Mr. Frank E. Schooley,
Treasurer,
National Association of Educational Broadcasters,
University of Illinois,
119 Gregory Hall,
Urbana, Illinois.
Dear Mr. Schooley,
I am glad to reply to your letter of October 9th
in which you asked my opinion regarding the ability, personality
and leadership of Professor Early Wynn.
I am happy to recommend to you my former colleague
and dear friend, Professor Early Wynn, formerly of the Depart¬
ment of Dramatic Arts and Professor of Speech, and now Director
of the Communications Center at the University of North Carolina.
Professor Wynn is, in my opinion, highly qualified
to be the new Executive Director of the NAEB. He has character,
ability, personality, imagination and leadership. His loyalty
is unquestioned. He served with the United States Navy in the
Second World War. He was long associated with Professor Frederick
H. Koch and with Professor Samuel Seldon. He has good health,
a good voice, and is an educational pioneer in the field of
dramatics, speech and broadcasting.
I would regret very much to see him leave the
University of North Carolina but, at the same time, I would
not wish to have him denied the opportunity which your considera¬
tion would open to him.
Yours sincerely.
—{j *
D
Frank P. Graham
